paper_metadata.title: Experimental characterization of energy consumption in 5 -axis milling machine and developing optimization strategy

energy_data.power_consumption: Base Consumption: 2011.43 Watts, Refrigeration: 2819.43 Watts, Chip Conveyer: 3694.37 Watts, Tool Changer: 191.96 Watts, Oil Mist: 320.78 Watts, Coolant: 1158.21 Watts, MR Process: 3287.00 Watts, Standby: 1.734 kW, Shutdown: 0 kW

kpi_metrics.specific_energy_consumption: T-SEC varies from 0.416 kJ/mm3 to 1.652 kJ/mm3
kpi_metrics.efficiency: Energy saving respect to original for chip conveyor: Roughing 30.08%, 45.26%, Finishing 79.95%, 89.97%.
other_kpis: Energy Consumption CHANGE: Power -up from Standby: 0.01932 kWh
Energy Consumption CHANGE: Power -up from Shutdown: 0.4413 kWh

additional_notes: The paper focuses on the experimental characterization of energy consumption in a 5-axis milling machine and explores optimization strategies, particularly by analyzing the contribution of auxiliary systems and optimizing process parameters. The study aims to reduce energy consumption and improve the overall efficiency of the milling process.
